description: From Middle French astrologie, and its source, Latin astrologia (“astronomy”), from Ancient Greek ἀστρολογία (astrología, “telling of the stars”), from ἄστρον (ástron, “star, planet, or constellation”) + -λογία (-logía, “treating of”), combination form of -λόγος (-lógos, “one who speaks (in a certain manner)”). Morphologically astro- +‎ -logy.

entries.meaning: Divination about human affairs or natural phenomena from the relative positions of celestial bodies. [from 14th c.]
examples: For if astronomy is the study of the movements of the heavens, then astrology is the study of the effects of those movements.
